page.title: 04The Cattle Market
page.content: The first thing we saw were the farmers weighing the lambs. This is called{grading.}It is done by weighing and feeling the quality of the lambs. While they are being graded the lambs are stamped with green dye.Some lambs had different coloured dyes on them already.This is to show which farm they came from.The lambs are split into different groups by how much they weigh .If there is much fat the're sold for less than if the lamb is lean .When we were there we saw some pigs and cattle.Some pigs were being brought to the sty.They smelt!When the {auctioneer}is selling the lambs he goes up in 10 pences.Once he's finished he'll bang his stick on the pens.After they have been sold,their ears are clipped.Within 21 days thay must be{slaughtered.}The pens are 1 metre high.
